tr: by the sanction or authority of
example: halt in the name of the law

tr: a language unit by which a person or thing is known
example: his name really is George Washington
those are two names for the same thing

tr: a defamatory or abusive word or phrase

example: he had no sons and there was no one to carry on his name
they studied all the great names in the history of France
she is an important figure in modern music
he wanted to protect his good name

tr: determine or distinguish the nature of a problem or an illness through a diagnostic analysis
identify as in botany or biology, for example
give or make a list of
example: List the states west of the Mississippi
His name was mentioned in connection with the invention

tr: give the name or identifying characteristics of
refer to by name or some other identifying characteristic property
example: Many senators were named in connection with the scandal
The almanac identifies the auspicious months

tr: assign a specified (usually proper) proper name to
example: The new school was named after the famous Civil Rights leader

tr: create and charge with a task or function

example: She was named Head of the Committee
She was made president of the club

example.tran: “他叫什么？”——“彼得。”
example.ex: 'What's his name?'—'Peter.'...

example.tran: 我甚至不知道沙利文是否是他的真名。
example.ex: I don't even know if Sullivan's his real name...

example.tran: 他们把街道名称改了。
example.ex: They changed the name of the street.

value.def: The name of a person, place, or thing is the word or group of words that is used to identify them.

example.tran: 我母亲坚持给我取名叫霍勒斯。
example.ex: My mother insisted on naming me Horace.

example.tran: 名叫约翰·T.本森的男人
example.ex: ...a man named John T. Benson...

example.tran: 他驾驭着这匹名副其实的“永不言败”夺得了他的第一个德比马赛冠军。
example.ex: He won his first Derby on the aptly named 'Never Say Die'.

value.def: When you name someone or something, you give them a name, usually at the beginning of their life.

example.tran: 为什么没让哪个儿子用你的名字呢？
example.ex: Why have you not named any of your sons after yourself?

value.def: If you name someone or something after another person or thing, you give them the same name as that person or thing.

example.tran: 一名记者因拒绝说出消息来源而入狱已经是近30年前的事了。
example.ex: It's nearly thirty years since a journalist was jailed for refusing to name a source...

example.tran: 周末暴风雪中的一名罹难者已确认是20岁的约翰·巴尔。
example.ex: One of the victims of the weekend's snowstorm has been named as twenty-year-old John Barr.

value.tran: 叫出…的名称;说出…的名字
value.def: If you name someone, you identify them by stating their name.

example.tran: 给马蒂打电话，让他出个价儿。
example.ex: Call Marty, tell him to name his price.

value.tran: 提出，说出，指出(价格、时间、地点等)
value.def: If you name something such as a price, time, or place, you say what you want it to be.

example.tran: 英格兰队主教练将任命新队长，接替受伤的大卫·贝克汉姆。
example.ex: The England manager will be naming a new captain, to replace the injured David Beckham...

example.tran: 坎贝尔公司的总裁退休后，麦戈文被选定为继任者。
example.ex: When the chairman of Campbell's retired, McGovern was named as his successor...

example.tran: 他早在1941年就被任命为非洲军团的指挥官。
example.ex: Early in 1941 he was named commander of the Afrika Korps.

gramarinfo.label: Also V n <l>as</l> n, V n n

value.def: If you name the person for a particular job, you say who you want to have the job.

example.tran: 他以判断准确而闻名。
example.ex: He had a name for good judgement...

example.tran: 她从没有吸过毒，也没做过任何有损爵士乐名声的事。
example.ex: She's never had any drug problems or done anything to give jazz a bad name.

value.def: You can refer to the reputation of a person or thing as their name .

example.tran: 模特和时装界一些最知名的红人
example.ex: ...some of the most famous names in modelling and show business.

example.tran: 耐克、李维斯、CK和汤米·希尔费格之类的顶级名牌
example.ex: ...top names such as Nike, Levi's, Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger.

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft adj N

value.def: You can refer to someone as, for example, a famous name or a great name when they are well-known.

xrsa.xrsa_see: assumed name;big name;brand name;Christian name;code name;first name;given name;maiden name;middle name;pet name

example.tran: 房子是我丈夫名下的。
example.ex: The house is in my husband's name...

example.tran: 已用穆勒的名字为他预订了一个双人间。
example.ex: A double room had been reserved for him in the name of Muller.

value.def: If something is in someone's name, it officially belongs to them or is reserved for them.

example.tran: 在美国，多数派代表民众执政。
example.ex: In the United States the majority governs in the name of the people...

example.tran: 她代表“拯救儿童基金会”接受了礼物。
example.ex: She accepted the gift in the name of the Save the Children Fund.

gramarinfo.label: PHR n, usu PHR after v

value.def: If someone does something in the name of a group of people, they do it as the representative of that group.

example.tran: 历史上少有的例子之一，政治领袖为更大的公共利益，甘冒丢官弃职的风险
example.ex: ...one of those rare occasions in history when a political leader risked his own power in the name of the greater public good...

example.tran: 有时人们打着做生意的幌子所做的事情让她感到恶心。
example.ex: There had been times when she had felt sickened by the things people did in the name of business.

gramarinfo.label: PHR n/-ing, usu PHR after v

value.def: If you do something in the name of an ideal or an abstract thing, you do it in order to preserve or promote that thing.

example.tran: 看在上帝份儿上，这到底是怎么回事？
example.ex: What in the name of heaven's going on?...

example.tran: 我以人道的名义请求政府重新评估这一重大问题。
example.ex: In the name of humanity I ask the government to reappraise this important issue.

value.tran: (加强提问或要求的语气)看在(上帝、人道等)的份儿上
value.def: People sometimes use expressions such as 'in the name of heaven' or 'in the name of humanity' to add emphasis to a question or request.

example.tran: 这一团体，现在是有实无名的政党
example.ex: ...the group, which is now a political party in all but name...

example.tran: 这实际上已是该学说的终结，只是未被道明罢了。
example.ex: It's the end of the doctrine in all but name.

gramarinfo.label: usu n/adj PHR, PHR with cl

value.tran: 有实无名的;未被认可的
value.def: If you say that a situation exists in all but name, you mean that it is not officially recognized even though it exists.

example.tran: 他跟顾客打招呼时直呼其名，并问他们身体可好。
example.ex: He greets customers by name and enquires about their health.

value.def: When you mention someone or something by name, or address someone by name, you use their name.

example.tran: 名叫哈里·巴斯蒂德的澳大利亚年轻人
example.ex: ...a young Australian, Harry Busteed by name...

example.tran: 这个叫杰克·史密斯的家伙是不是还有个名字叫杰凯尔？
example.ex: This guy, Jack Smith, does he go by the name of Jackal?

value.def: You can use by name or by the name of when you are saying what someone is called.

example.tran: 在之前的学校，因为我反应慢，他们骂过我。
example.ex: At my last school they called me names because I was so slow...

example.tran: 他们用粗鲁的言语谩骂她。
example.ex: They had called her rude names.

value.def: If someone calls you names, they insult you by saying unpleasant things to you or about you.

example.tran: 家庭价值观突然变得重要起来。
example.ex: Family values are suddenly the name of the game...

example.tran: 重要的是活下去。
example.ex: The name of the game is survival.

value.def: If you say that something is the name of the game, you mean that it is the most important aspect of a situation.

example.tran: 他很有政治见解，对很多事业都予以支持。
example.ex: He had political points of view and lent his name to a lot of causes.

value.def: If you lend your name to something such as a cause or project, you support it.

example.tran: 她开始成为一个小有名气的人像摄影师。
example.ex: She was beginning to make a name for herself as a portrait photographer...

example.tran: 他是以几部短篇小说集成名的。
example.ex: He made his name with several collections of short stories.

value.def: If you make a name for yourself or make your name as something, you become well-known for that thing.

example.tran: 没有人愿意冒着被起诉的风险去真正指认别人。
example.ex: Nobody was prepared to risk prosecution by actually naming names.

value.tran: 点出(或指出)(做错事者)的名字
value.def: If you name names, you identify the people who have done something, often something wrong.

example.tran: 政府还将曝光业绩最差的航空公司。
example.ex: The government will also name and shame the worst performing airlines.

value.tran: (指报纸或官方机构)曝光，点名，指名(业绩差或犯错的人)
value.def: If something such as a newspaper or an official body names and shames people who have performed badly or who have done something wrong, it identifies those people by name.

example.tran: 许多团体实际上是有名无实。
example.ex: Many of the groups exist in name only...

example.tran: 他只是名义上的总司令。
example.ex: He is commander-in-chief in name only.

value.def: If you say that a situation exists in name only, you mean that it does not have the status or position that it claims to have.

example.tran: 酸黄瓜、果酱、腌浆果、西红柿，凡是你说得出的，他们都有。
example.ex: Pickled cucumbers, jam, pickled berries, tomatoes; you name it, they've got it...

example.tran: 我也喜欢帆板、网球、短柄墙球、游泳等等，不一而足。
example.ex: I also enjoy windsurfing, tennis, racquetball, swimming, you name it.

value.tran: 凡是你说得出的，凡是你能想到的(应有尽有)
value.def: You say you name it, usually after or before a list, to indicate that you are talking about a very wide range of things.

data.enText: a word or words that a particular person, animal, place or thing is known by
data.chText: 名字；名称

data.enText: What's your name?
data.chText: 你叫什么名字？

data.enText: What is/was the name, please? (= a polite way of asking sb's name)
data.chText: 请问您叫什么名字？

data.enText: Please write your full name and address below.
data.chText: 请将您的姓名和地址写在下面。

data.enText: Do you know the name of this flower?
data.chText: 你知道这是什么花吗？

data.enText: Rubella is just another name for German measles.
data.chText: 风疹只是德国麻疹的另一个名称。

data.enText: Are you changing your name when you get married?
data.chText: 结婚时你要改姓氏吗？

data.enText: a user/file name
data.chText: 用户 / 文件名

data.enText: a reputation that sb/sth has; the opinion that people have about sb/sth
data.chText: 名誉；名声；名气

data.enText: She first made her name as a writer of children's books.
data.chText: 她最初是以儿童读物作家成名的。

data.enText: He's made quite a name for himself (= become famous) .
data.chText: 他闯出了名气。

data.enText: The college has a good name for languages.
data.chText: 这所大学的语言教学颇有名气。

data.enText: This kind of behaviour gives students a bad name .
data.chText: 这种行为使学生们背上骂名。

data.enText: having a name or a reputation of the kind mentioned, especially one that is known by a lot of people
data.chText: 有…名称的；以…著名的；有…名声的

data.enText: a big-name company
data.chText: 著名公司

data.enText: brand-name goods
data.chText: 名牌产品

data.enText: a famous person
data.chText: 名人

data.enText: Some of the biggest names in the art world were at the party.
data.chText: 一些艺术界的头面人物参加了聚会。

data.enText: by name
using the name of sb/sth
data.chText: 凭名字；用…的名字

data.enText: She asked for you by name.
data.chText: 她点名要找你。

data.enText: The principal knows all the students by name.
data.chText: 校长能叫出所有学生的姓名。

data.enText: I only know her by name (= I have heard about her but I have not met her).
data.chText: 我只是听说过她的名字。

data.enText: by the name of…
who is called
data.chText: 名叫…的

data.enText: a young actor by the name of Tom Rees
data.chText: 名叫汤姆∙里斯的年轻演员

data.enText: enter sb's/your name (for sth)
put sb's/your name down (for sth)
to apply for a place at a school, in a competition, etc. for sb or yourself
data.chText: 申请参加；替…报名（入学、参赛等）

data.enText: Have you entered your name for the quiz yet?
data.chText: 你申请参加这次问答比赛了吗？

data.enText: give your name to sth
to invent sth which then becomes known by your name
data.chText: 用自己的名字命名所发明之物

data.enText: go by the name of…
to use a name that may not be your real one
data.chText: 自称为…；假称是…

data.enText: have your/sb's name on it
with your/sb's name on it
if sth has your name on it , or there is sth with your name on it , it is intended for you
data.chText: 是冲…来的；是为…准备的

data.enText: He took my place and got killed. It should have been me─that bullet had my name on it.
data.chText: 他坐了我的位子而送了命。死的应该是我，那颗子弹是冲着我来的。

data.enText: Are you coming for dinner this evening? I've got a steak here with your name on it!
data.chText: 今晚你来吃饭吗？我为你准备了一块牛排。

data.enText: in all but name
used to describe a situation which exists in reality but that is not officially recognized
data.chText: （表示实际存在但未得到正式认可）在只缺正式名分情况下

data.enText: He runs the company in all but name.
data.chText: 他虽没有名义，却实际上在管理这家公司。

data.enText: in God's/Heaven's name
in the name of God/Heaven
used especially in questions to show that you are angry, surprised or shocked
data.chText: （尤用于疑问句，表示愤怒、惊奇和震惊）看在上帝的份儿上，到底，究竟

data.enText: What in God's name was that noise?
data.chText: 那噪音究竟是怎么回事？

data.enText: Where in the name of Heaven have you been?
data.chText: 你到底上哪儿去了？

data.enText: in the name of sb/sth
in sb's/sth's name
for sb; showing that sth officially belongs to sb
data.chText: 为（某人）；在…名下

data.enText: We reserved two tickets in the name of Brown.
data.chText: 我们用布朗的名字预订了两张票。

data.enText: The car is registered in my name.
data.chText: 这辆车是用我的名字登记的。

data.enText: using the authority of sb/sth; as a representative of sb/sth
data.chText: 凭…的权威；代表

data.enText: I arrest you in the name of the law.
data.chText: 我依法逮捕你。

data.enText: used to give a reason or an excuse for doing sth, often when what you are doing is wrong
data.chText: 以…的名义；以…为借口

data.enText: crimes committed in the name of religion
data.chText: 以宗教名义进行的犯罪活动

data.enText: in name only
officially recognized but not existing in reality
data.chText: 名义上；有名无实

data.enText: He's party leader in name only.
data.chText: 他只是名义上的政党领袖。

data.enText: sb's name is mud
used to say that sb is not liked or popular because of sth they have done
data.chText: 某人臭名昭著

data.enText: the name of the game
the most important aspect of an activity; the most important quality needed for an activity
data.chText: 问题的实质；最为重要的方面

data.enText: Hard work is the name of the game if you want to succeed in business.
data.chText: 要想生意兴旺，勤奋工作是关键。

data.enText: put a name to sb/sth
to know or remember what sb/sth is called
data.chText: 知道…的名称；记住…的称呼

data.enText: I recognize the tune but I can't put a name to it.
data.chText: 这曲子我听过，但想不起叫什么了。

data.enText: take sb's name in vain
to show a lack of respect when using sb's name
data.chText: 滥用…的名义；亵渎…的名字

data.enText: Have you been taking my name in vain again?
data.chText: 你又在滥用我的名义吧？

data.enText: (have sth) to your name
to have or own sth
data.chText: 拥有；获得；收归某人的名下

data.enText: an Olympic athlete with five gold medals to his name
data.chText: 夺得五枚金牌的一名奥林匹克运动员

data.enText: She doesn't have a penny/cent to her name (= she is very poor) .
data.chText: 她身无分文。

data.enText: under the name (of)…
using a name that may not be your real name
data.chText: 用…名字；以…假名

data.enText: answer to the name of sth
to be called sth
data.chText: 名叫；叫做

data.enText: a big noise/shot/name
an important person
data.chText: 大人物；要人

data.enText: call sb names
to use insulting words about sb
data.chText: 辱骂；谩骂

data.enText: give a dog a bad name
when a person already has a bad reputation, it is difficult to change it because others will continue to blame or suspect him/her
data.chText: 恶名难洗；名声一毁，万难挽回

data.enText: drop names
to mention famous people you know or have met in order to impress others
data.chText: 提及自己认识或见过的名人以抬高身价

data.enText: lend your name to sth
to let it be known in public that you support or agree with sth
data.chText: 公开表示支持

data.enText: I am more than happy to lend my name to this campaign.
data.chText: 我非常愿意公开表示支持这个运动。

data.enText: to have a place named after you
data.chText: 以…的名字命名（某地方）

data.enText: be sb's middle name
used to say that sb has a lot of a particular quality
data.chText: 是某人的突出个性

data.enText: ‘Patience’ is my middle name!
data.chText: 我的最大特点就是有耐心！

data.enText: name names
to give the names of the people involved in sth, especially sth wrong or illegal
data.chText: 供出，说出（犯事者等）的名字

data.enText: a rose by any other name would smell as sweet
what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
data.chText: 玫瑰不叫玫瑰，依然芳香如故；名称并不是重要的东西

data.enText: to give a name to sb/sth
data.chText: 命名；给…取名

data.enText: He was named after his father (= given his father's first name) .
data.chText: 他的名字跟他父亲一样。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: They named their son John.
data.chText: 他们给儿子起了个名字叫约翰。

data.enText: to say the name of sb/sth
data.chText: 说出…的名称；叫出…的名字

data.enText: The victim has not yet been named.
data.chText: 受害人的姓名仍未得知。

data.enText: The missing man has been named as James Kelly.
data.chText: 失踪者已被确认为詹姆斯∙凯利。

data.enText: Can you name all the American states?
data.chText: 你能说出美国所有的州名吗？

data.enText: to state sth exactly
data.chText: 确定；说定；准确陈述

data.enText: Name your price .
data.chText: 给个价吧。

data.enText: They're engaged, but they haven't yet named the day (= chosen the date for their wedding) .
data.chText: 他们订婚了，但还未确定结婚日期。

data.enText: Activities available include squash, archery and swimming, to name but a few .
data.chText: 所设活动项目包括壁球、射箭、游泳等等，不一而足。

data.enText: Chairs, tables, cabinets─ you name it , she makes it (= she makes anything you can imagine) .
data.chText: 椅子、桌子、橱柜——凡是你说得出的她都能做。

data.enText: to choose sb for a job or position
data.chText: 任命；委任

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+名词短语

data.enText: I had no hesitation in naming him (as) captain.
data.chText: 我毫不犹豫地任命他为队长。

data.enText: When she resigned, he was named to the committee in her place.
data.chText: 她辞职后，他被指定取代她进入委员会。

data.enText: name and shame
to publish the names of people or organizations who have done sth wrong or illegal
data.chText: 公布行为不当或违法者的名单；公布黑名单

data.enText: name names
to give the names of the people involved in sth, especially sth wrong or illegal
data.chText: 供出，说出（犯事者等）的名字

data.enText: Names
data.chText: 名字

data.enText: Your name is either your whole name or one part of your name.
data.chText: name既指全名也指名字的一部分：

data.enText: My name is Maria.
data.chText: 我的名字叫玛丽亚。

data.enText: His name is Tom Smith.
data.chText: 他的名字叫汤姆∙史密斯。

data.enText: Your last name or family name (also called surname in BrE ) is the name that all members of your family share.
data.chText: last name或family name（在英国英语中亦叫surname）指姓氏。

data.enText: Your first name/names ( formal forename ) is/are the name(s) your parents gave you when you were born. In BrE some people use the expression Christian name(s ) to refer to a person’s first name(s).
data.chText: first name/names（正式用语为forename）指出生时父母给取的名字。在英国英语中，有些人用Christian name(s)指first name(s)（名字）。

data.enText: Your middle name(s) is/are any name your parents gave you other than the one that is placed first. The initial of this name is often used as part of your name, especially in America.
data.chText: middle name(s)指父母给取的第一名字外的名字。此名字的首字母常用作名字的一部分，尤其在美国：

data.enText: John T. Harvey
data.chText: 约翰∙ T.哈维

data.enText: Your full name is all your names, usually in the order: first + middle + last name
data.chText: full name通常指以first + middle + last name为顺序的全名。

data.enText: A woman’s maiden name is the family name she had before she got married. Some women keep this name after they are married and do not use their husband’s name. In North America, married women often use their maiden name followed by their husband’s family name.
data.chText: maiden name指女子婚前娘家的姓。有的妇女婚后仍保留此姓，不用丈夫的姓。在北美，已婚妇女通常在自己娘家的姓后加上丈夫的姓：

data.enText: Hillary Rodham Clinton
data.chText: 希拉里∙罗德姆∙克林顿

data.enText: Titles
data.chText: 称谓

data.enText: Mr (for both married and unmarried men)
data.chText: 称已婚和未婚男子

data.enText: Mrs (for married women)
data.chText: 称已婚妇女

data.enText: Miss (for unmarried women)
data.chText: 称未婚女子

data.enText: Ms (a title that some women prefer to use as it does not distinguish between married and unmarried women)
data.chText: 有些妇女喜欢用此称谓，因为没有指明已婚或未婚

data.enText: Doctor , Professor , President , Vice-President , Reverend (or Rev ), etc.
data.chText: 医生、教授、校长、副校长、牧师等

data.enText: The correct way to talk to someone is
data.chText: 正确的称呼为：

data.enText: first name, if you know them well
data.chText: 如果相熟可直呼其名：

data.enText: Hello, Maria.
data.chText: 你好，玛丽亚。

data.enText: or title + surname
data.chText: 或称谓 + 姓：

data.enText: Hello, Mr Brown.
data.chText: 你好，布朗先生。

data.enText: or Doctor (medical), Professor , etc. on its own
data.chText: 或单独用医生、教授等：

data.enText: Thank you, Doctor.
data.chText: 谢谢你，医生。

data.enText: This is only used for a very limited number of titles.
data.chText: 此说法只用于非常有限的一些称谓中。

data.enText: by name
using the name of sb/sth
data.chText: 凭名字；用…的名字

data.enText: She asked for you by name.
data.chText: 她点名要找你。

data.enText: The principal knows all the students by name.
data.chText: 校长能叫出所有学生的姓名。

data.enText: I only know her by name (= I have heard about her but I have not met her).
data.chText: 我只是听说过她的名字。

data.enText: by the name of…
who is called
data.chText: 名叫…的

data.enText: a young actor by the name of Tom Rees
data.chText: 名叫汤姆∙里斯的年轻演员

data.enText: enter sb's/your name (for sth)
put sb's/your name down (for sth)
to apply for a place at a school, in a competition, etc. for sb or yourself
data.chText: 申请参加；替…报名（入学、参赛等）

data.enText: Have you entered your name for the quiz yet?
data.chText: 你申请参加这次问答比赛了吗？

data.enText: give your name to sth
to invent sth which then becomes known by your name
data.chText: 用自己的名字命名所发明之物

data.enText: go by the name of…
to use a name that may not be your real one
data.chText: 自称为…；假称是…

data.enText: have your/sb's name on it
with your/sb's name on it
if sth has your name on it , or there is sth with your name on it , it is intended for you
data.chText: 是冲…来的；是为…准备的

data.enText: He took my place and got killed. It should have been me─that bullet had my name on it.
data.chText: 他坐了我的位子而送了命。死的应该是我，那颗子弹是冲着我来的。

data.enText: Are you coming for dinner this evening? I've got a steak here with your name on it!
data.chText: 今晚你来吃饭吗？我为你准备了一块牛排。

data.enText: in all but name
used to describe a situation which exists in reality but that is not officially recognized
data.chText: （表示实际存在但未得到正式认可）在只缺正式名分情况下

data.enText: He runs the company in all but name.
data.chText: 他虽没有名义，却实际上在管理这家公司。

data.enText: in God's/Heaven's name
in the name of God/Heaven
used especially in questions to show that you are angry, surprised or shocked
data.chText: （尤用于疑问句，表示愤怒、惊奇和震惊）看在上帝的份儿上，到底，究竟

data.enText: What in God's name was that noise?
data.chText: 那噪音究竟是怎么回事？

data.enText: Where in the name of Heaven have you been?
data.chText: 你到底上哪儿去了？

data.enText: in the name of sb/sth
in sb's/sth's name
for sb; showing that sth officially belongs to sb
data.chText: 为（某人）；在…名下

data.enText: We reserved two tickets in the name of Brown.
data.chText: 我们用布朗的名字预订了两张票。

data.enText: The car is registered in my name.
data.chText: 这辆车是用我的名字登记的。

data.enText: using the authority of sb/sth; as a representative of sb/sth
data.chText: 凭…的权威；代表

data.enText: I arrest you in the name of the law.
data.chText: 我依法逮捕你。

data.enText: used to give a reason or an excuse for doing sth, often when what you are doing is wrong
data.chText: 以…的名义；以…为借口

data.enText: crimes committed in the name of religion
data.chText: 以宗教名义进行的犯罪活动

data.enText: in name only
officially recognized but not existing in reality
data.chText: 名义上；有名无实

data.enText: He's party leader in name only.
data.chText: 他只是名义上的政党领袖。

data.enText: sb's name is mud
used to say that sb is not liked or popular because of sth they have done
data.chText: 某人臭名昭著

data.enText: the name of the game
the most important aspect of an activity; the most important quality needed for an activity
data.chText: 问题的实质；最为重要的方面

data.enText: Hard work is the name of the game if you want to succeed in business.
data.chText: 要想生意兴旺，勤奋工作是关键。

data.enText: put a name to sb/sth
to know or remember what sb/sth is called
data.chText: 知道…的名称；记住…的称呼

data.enText: I recognize the tune but I can't put a name to it.
data.chText: 这曲子我听过，但想不起叫什么了。

data.enText: take sb's name in vain
to show a lack of respect when using sb's name
data.chText: 滥用…的名义；亵渎…的名字

data.enText: Have you been taking my name in vain again?
data.chText: 你又在滥用我的名义吧？

data.enText: (have sth) to your name
to have or own sth
data.chText: 拥有；获得；收归某人的名下

data.enText: an Olympic athlete with five gold medals to his name
data.chText: 夺得五枚金牌的一名奥林匹克运动员

data.enText: She doesn't have a penny/cent to her name (= she is very poor) .
data.chText: 她身无分文。

data.enText: under the name (of)…
using a name that may not be your real name
data.chText: 用…名字；以…假名

data.enText: answer to the name of sth
to be called sth
data.chText: 名叫；叫做

data.enText: a big noise/shot/name
an important person
data.chText: 大人物；要人

data.enText: call sb names
to use insulting words about sb
data.chText: 辱骂；谩骂

data.enText: give a dog a bad name
when a person already has a bad reputation, it is difficult to change it because others will continue to blame or suspect him/her
data.chText: 恶名难洗；名声一毁，万难挽回

data.enText: drop names
to mention famous people you know or have met in order to impress others
data.chText: 提及自己认识或见过的名人以抬高身价

data.enText: lend your name to sth
to let it be known in public that you support or agree with sth
data.chText: 公开表示支持

data.enText: I am more than happy to lend my name to this campaign.
data.chText: 我非常愿意公开表示支持这个运动。

data.enText: to have a place named after you
data.chText: 以…的名字命名（某地方）

data.enText: be sb's middle name
used to say that sb has a lot of a particular quality
data.chText: 是某人的突出个性

data.enText: ‘Patience’ is my middle name!
data.chText: 我的最大特点就是有耐心！

data.enText: name names
to give the names of the people involved in sth, especially sth wrong or illegal
data.chText: 供出，说出（犯事者等）的名字

data.enText: rejoice in the name of…
to have a name that sounds funny
data.chText: 有个滑稽的名字

data.enText: He rejoiced in the name of Owen Owen.
data.chText: 他有个滑稽的名字叫欧文∙欧文。

data.enText: a rose by any other name would smell as sweet
what is important is what people or things are, not what they are called
data.chText: 玫瑰不叫玫瑰，依然芳香如故；名称并不是重要的东西

data.enText: name and shame
to publish the names of people or organizations who have done sth wrong or illegal
data.chText: 公布行为不当或违法者的名单；公布黑名单

data.enText: name names
to give the names of the people involved in sth, especially sth wrong or illegal
data.chText: 供出，说出（犯事者等）的名字

synonyms.bx: 指不经投票选举等而直接指派。常可与介词 as 连用，但现在经常将其省略。

ex.enText: She was appointed (as) postmaster of the city of York.
ex.chText: 她被任命为约克市邮政局局长。

ex.enText: We appointed him to the committee.
ex.chText: 我们委派他为委员会成员。

synonyms.bx: 通常指为某项工作或某个目的而任命，多用被动语态。

ex.enText: Who has he designated (as) his deputy?
ex.chText: 他选定了谁当他的副手？

ex.enText: She was designated to take over the position of treasurer.
ex.chText: 她被选派接任财务主管的职务。

synonyms.bx: 指由官方选定某人或某物，尤指使其担任重要职务，常可与介词 as 连用，但现在经常将其省略。

ex.enText: The president named her (as) Secretary of the State.
At the age of 30, she was named to the committee by the chairman.
ex.chText: 她30岁的时候被主席选入该委员会。

synonyms.bx: 既可指提出人选，由有决策权的人定夺，也可指直接委任，常后接介词 as/to。

ex.enText: Next month Mr. Smith will retire and Mr. Brown will be nominated as his replacement.
ex.chText: 下月史密斯先生退休，布朗先生将获任命接替他的职位。

ex.enText: She was nominated to the committee.
ex.chText: 她被任命为委员会委员。
